verses.plain: He, that being often reproved hardeneth his neck, shall suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy.

tokens.t: He, that being often reproved hardeneth
neck, shall suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy.

verses.plain: When the righteous are in authority, the people rejoice: but when the wicked beareth rule, the people mourn.

tokens.t: When the righteous are in authority, the people rejoice: but when the wicked beareth rule, the people mourn.

verses.plain: Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father: but he that keepeth company with harlots spendeth his substance.

tokens.t: Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father: but he that keepeth company with harlots spendeth
substance.

verses.plain: The king by judgment establisheth the land: but he that receiveth gifts overthroweth it.

tokens.t: The king by judgment establisheth the land: but he that receiveth gifts overthroweth it.

verses.plain: A man that flattereth his neighbour spreadeth a net for his feet.

tokens.t: A man that flattereth his neighbour spreadeth a net for his feet.

verses.plain: In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare: but the righteous doth sing and rejoice.

tokens.t: In the transgression of an evil man
a snare: but the righteous doth sing and rejoice.

verses.plain: The righteous considereth the cause of the poor: but the wicked regardeth not to know it.

tokens.t: The righteous considereth the cause of the poor:
the wicked regardeth not to know

verses.plain: Scornful men bring a city into a snare: but wise men turn away wrath.

tokens.t: Scornful men bring a city into a snare: but wise
turn away wrath.

verses.plain: If a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, whether he rage or laugh, there is no rest.

tokens.t: a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, whether he rage or laugh,
no rest.

verses.plain: The bloodthirsty hate the upright: but the just seek his soul.

tokens.t: The bloodthirsty hate the upright: but the just seek his soul.

verses.plain: A fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till afterwards.

tokens.t: A fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise
keepeth it in till afterwards.

verses.plain: If a ruler hearken to lies, all his servants are wicked.

tokens.t: If a ruler hearken to lies, all his servants
wicked.

verses.plain: The poor and the deceitful man meet together: the LORD lighteneth both their eyes.

tokens.t: The poor and the deceitful man meet together: the
lighteneth both their eyes.

verses.plain: The king that faithfully judgeth the poor, his throne shall be established for ever.

tokens.t: The king that faithfully judgeth the poor, his throne shall be established for ever.

verses.plain: The rod and reproof give wisdom: but a child left to himself bringeth his mother to shame.

tokens.t: The rod and reproof give wisdom: but a child left
bringeth his mother to shame.

verses.plain: When the wicked are multiplied, transgression increaseth: but the righteous shall see their fall.

tokens.t: When the wicked are multiplied, transgression increaseth: but the righteous shall see their fall.

verses.plain: Correct thy son, and he shall give thee rest; yea, he shall give delight unto thy soul.

tokens.t: Correct thy son, and he shall give thee rest; yea, he shall give delight unto thy soul.

verses.plain: Where there is no vision, the people perish: but he that keepeth the law, happy is he.

tokens.t: Where
no vision, the people perish: but he that keepeth the law, happy
he.

verses.plain: A servant will not be corrected by words: for though he understand he will not answer.

tokens.t: A servant will not be corrected by words: for though he understand he will not answer.

verses.plain: Seest thou a man that is hasty in his words? there is more hope of a fool than of him.

tokens.t: Seest thou a man
hasty in his words?
more hope of a fool than of him.

verses.plain: He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child shall have him become his son at the length.

tokens.t: He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child shall have him become
son at the length.

verses.plain: An angry man stirreth up strife, and a furious man aboundeth in transgression.

tokens.t: An angry man stirreth up strife, and a furious man aboundeth in transgression.

verses.plain: A man’s pride shall bring him low: but honour shall uphold the humble in spirit.

tokens.t: A man’s pride shall bring him low: but honour shall uphold the humble in spirit.

verses.plain: Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul: he heareth cursing, and bewrayeth it not.

tokens.t: Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul: he heareth cursing, and bewrayeth
not.

verses.plain: The fear of man bringeth a snare: but whoso putteth his trust in the LORD shall be safe.

tokens.t: The fear of man bringeth a snare: but whoso putteth his trust in the
shall be safe.

verses.plain: Many seek the ruler’s favour; but every man’s judgment cometh from the LORD.

tokens.t: Many seek the ruler’s favour; but
man’s judgment
from the

verses.plain: An unjust man is an abomination to the just: and he that is upright in the way is abomination to the wicked.

tokens.t: An unjust man
an abomination to the just: and
upright in the way
abomination to the wicked.

footnotes.text: He…: Heb. A man of reproofs
he…: Heb. a man of oblations
bring…: or, set a city on fire
The bloodthirsty: Heb. Men of blood
the ruler’s…: Heb. the face of a ruler
